document.masterDocTitle: Phylogenetic relationships, systematics, and biology of the species of Amorbia Clemens (Lepidoptera: Tortricidae: Sparganothini).

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Phylogenetic relationships, systematics, and biology of the species of Amorbia Clemens (Lepidoptera: Tortricidae: Sparganothini).

subSubSection.paragraph:
DIAGNOSIS. This species is easily distinguished by the unmodified vertex of the head and the forewing costal fold without spines. It is most similar to
A. exustana
, but
A. osmotris
can be distinguished by the presence of struts of the socii and the sacculus extending to the margin of the valva.

REDESCRIPTION. MALE. FW length 12.0–14.0 mm (mean = 13.0; n = 10). HEAD: Frons convex, white scaled, vertex rough, rust colored. Antenna with brown scaling. Labial palpus at least 3.0X length of antennal space, porrect, rust colored laterally, lighter on inner surface. THORAX: Dorsum smooth scaled, rust colored; tegula concolorous. FW ground color light brown, pattern variable from extremely faint to well developed bands or patches. Costal fold well developed, short, reaching 0.25 of FW length. HW white with gray mottling toward apex, cubital pecten at base of vein. ABDOMEN: Light brown. Genitalia as in Fig. 76 (slide # JAP 3131, EME, Costa Rica , Cartago , Cerro de la Muerte; n = 11). Struts of socii present. Valva subrectangular. Sacculus sclerotized, extending beyond margin of valva, emarginate in distal 0.5. Aedeagus 0.7X length of valva, slender, curved in distal 0.25.

FEMALE. FW length 14.0–15.0 mm (mean = 14.6; n = 10). HEAD and THORAX: As described for male. ABDOMEN: Genitalia as in Fig. 100 (slide # 2472228, INBio , Costa Rica , San José , Estación Cuericí ; n = 5). Lamella antevaginalis with lateral pockets pointed anteriorly; median sinus rounded. Ductus bursae parallel-sided, posterior 0.25 with boot-shaped sclerotization
.

paragraph.materialsCitation:
TYPE MATERIAL. Holotype : Male : COSTA RICA , Irazú ,
2200–2500 m
, 21/28.v.30, Reimoser ( BMNH ).

subSubSection.paragraph:
ADDITIONAL MATERIAL. COSTA RICA : ALAJUELA : Mount Poás, 1M [no date] (W. Schaus, USNM ); Volcán Poás 2350 m , 1M, 1F, 19.xii.1981 , 1F, 12.vii.1982 , 3M, 15.xii.1982 (D. Janzen & W. DISTRIBUTION AND BIOLOGY. This species was found only in Costa Rica , and above 2000 m elevation ( Fig. 135 ). It was collected in every month of the year.

HOST PLANT RECORDS.
Amorbia osmotris
was reared from larvae found on
Rubus sp.
( Rosaceae ),
Weinmannia pinnata , Pernetia
coriaceae ,
Vaccinium sp.
( Ericaceae ), and
Quercus costarricensis
( Fagaceae ) (Appendix III).
